thread.title_full: UPDATE 1-Ukraine bans Aeroflot, other Russian airlines, from flying to Ukraine - PM | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: UPDATE 1-Ukraine bans Aeroflot, other Russian airlines, from flying to Ukraine - PM
text:
(Adds background)
KIEV, Sept 25 (Reuters) - Ukraine announced on Friday it was banning Russian airlines, including Aeroflot, from flying into Ukraine, as part of a wave of sanctions against Russia over its support for separatists in the east.
The action against Aeroflot, standard bearer of the Russian passenger air fleet, and other Russian air carriers such as Transaero, gave detail of Ukrainian restrictions imposed last week on more than 90 companies or groups, mostly from Russia, and on 900 individuals for reasons of "national security."
"In accordance with a decision by the Security Council, the government of Ukraine is adopting a decision to ban flights by Russian companies, primarily Aeroflot and Transaero, to Ukraine," Prime Minister Arseny Yatseniuk told a government meeting, according to the government website.
"Russian planes with the Russian tricolour have no business in Ukrainian airports," Yatseniuk said, adding that any Russian planes carrying military hardware or troops had also been banned from flying over Ukrainian territory.
The statement by Yatseniuk also forbade Ukrainian state companies from using Russian software, particularly from Russian anti-virus giant Kaspersky Lab.
Ukrainian state organisations were banned from using goods or services produced by sanctioned Russian companies. "The government is insisting on the immediate implementation of all sanctions defined by the decision of the Security Council," Yatseniuk said.
The government statement gave no indication of when the new regulations and the ban on Russian airlines would come into force.
(Reporting by Pavel Polityuk; Writing By Richard Balmforth ; Editing by Alessandra Prentice)
